Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, with very faint traces of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.141-2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87656) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87656)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 173 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
